body.name: Asus ROG Maximus XIII Extreme Glacial (WiFi 6E) Z590 LGA 1200(Intel® 11th) EATX gaming motherboard (PCIe 4.0,18+2 power stages,integrated EK water block, 5xM.2 slots, 2xThunderbolt™ 4, 10 & 2.5Gb LAN)
body.stockDetail: Only 1 left in stock - order soon.
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Prime Trade Shop (S/N Recorded) and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 2 hrs 17 mins
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 2 hrs 17 mins
features: Intel LGA 1200 socket: Designed to unleash the maximum performance of 11th Gen Intel Core processors
Optimized Thermal Design: Integrated EK water block that cools VRM, CPU and PCH; high-conductivity thermal pads, five M.2 heatsinks with embedded backplates and ROG Water-Cooling Zone

AI Motherboard : AI Overclocking, AI cooling, AI networking and AI noise cancelation; Unmatched Personalization: 2” LiveDash color OLED, ASUS-exclusive Aura Sync RGB lighting, including one RGB header and three addressable Gen 2 RGB headers; DIY-Friendly Design: Pre-mounted I/O shield, V_Latch switch, BIOS FlashBack, Q-Code, FlexKey, Q-Connector, SafeSlot and Graphics Card Holder

Extreme Power Solution: 18+2 teamed power stages - each rated at 100 Amps, ProCool II power connectors, MicroFine alloy chokes and 10K Japanese-made black metallic capacitors; Fattest Gaming Connectivity: PCIe 4.0, five M.2 slots, USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 front-panel connector, dual Thunderbolt 4 USB-C ;Industry-leading Gaming Audio & AI Noise Cancelation: High fidelity audio with the SupremeFX ALC4082 CODECESS, DTS Sound Unbound and Sonic Studio III draws you deeper into the game action.Communicate clearly with ASUS AI Noise Cancelation technology

Superb Thermal Design: Enlarged VRM heatsinks plus integrated aluminum I/O cover, high-conductivity thermal pad, five M.2 heatsinks with embedded backplates and ROG Water-Cooling Zone Future Proof Gaming Networking: Intel WiFi 6E AX210 pair with ROG Rapture GT-AXE11000 to enjoy world’s first 6HGz wireless transfer speed, dual Ethernet with Marvell AQtion 10Gb and Intel 2.5Gb Ethernet;
body.description: The Asus ROG Maximus XIII Extreme Glacial (WiFi 6E) integrated full-coverage EK water block built for max performance water-cooling enthusiasts with ultimate performance combined with efficient, reliable operation.Expertly tuned by our ROG Engineers to bring you the ultimate performance to achieve optimized overclocking, high-speed memory support and comprehensive water and fan cooling controls.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.0 4.0 out of 5 stars 20 ratings 4.0 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Expressing it quality in one short word of being “Amazing” isn’t even enough to describe how good this Motherboard is. Please allow me sometimes to dissect it in details laterBut to sum it up, it is worth every penny at this price from Amazon, which is a sub $1200. Yet, it is Gen 11th, and it is expensive, but it runs like no others I have had the chance of owning. My 11900KF runs a cool 45C-54C under heavy load of maxed out COD MW2.0 , and constantly running at 4.9Ghz to 5.3Ghz on all core by simply enabling ASUS AI over clock, which is a one button solution and be done with itGiven the nature of it being water cooled, I paired it with ICUE HydroX from corsairs and D5000 case with additional fans.I can not complain about anything that this MB does. Of course, a lot of researches went into my decision to buy it, and I did not expect to see my 11th Gen to run breezily upto 5.3Ghz. To cut the technical details down a bit, the reasons why I bought this MB is because I do know how important a MB is, and the main reason why OC people can not max out their CPU potentials. It was all due to the VRM stages and cooling stages. Previously, Manufacturers were afraid to design high-end MB due to the $$ cost of productions and sales. Luckily, at the moment, they are doing it. What is better to cool your MB than using Water block for everything ? Especially being pure copper of 99.99% ? Cooling your VRM, CPU, chipset altogether ? And at this price, the Waterblock alone by itself is already worth the money. You may not believe me when I say “production of the water block is very expensive”. It is not easy to fabricate the block correctly with all the different dimensional cuts, lines, grooves, and importantly being a solid mono block of them all. To top that off, design it in a way that it is so DIY and you just can not mess it up. From the design, to the CNC milling for productions, it is very expensive.Even when you put that aside, there are other factors about the Mb that makes it worthy, first and foremost is the VRM stages, packing 20 phases total and with deadly precision is what enabled me to clock in from 4.9-5.3Ghz constantly. Then there are the utilizations of PCIE 3 to enable 3 slots for the M2 Drives, which allow one single dedicated PCIE 4x16 just to satisfy the desire of maxing out your beloved 4090.Next up is that simplistic OC at one button. This was done by ASUS geniuses. It set OC for both CPU and memory alike with AI constantly monitoring the parameters to enable the best there it to be achieved.If you also care about HiFi audio, the onboard ESS can drive HD800S to excellent level for gaming, movies, music all alike. Of course it won’t be replacing your high end dedicated audiophile system anytime soon. However, it is a lot and a lot better than integrated Intel stuff.I didn’t have the leisure to try and compare the Aorus MB , but so far, seeing my achievements, I say it is worth every Pennie’s I paid for it and can not be any happier. Down right the best OC and PC I have ever built, especially that one button AI OC system. It amazes me. I like to OC stuff but I hate the headachesUpdates*: after running AI overclock for a week, seeing the varieties of different CPU voltages bothers me as the AI adjusts it on the fly. I have turned into manual OC. Using 4000Mhz RAM, and I am able to steadily, constantly OC all cores to 5.1Ghz with just 1.25V VCore. Now, I like things that are steady. For all that is said, the MB keeps on giving, and I keep on loving it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s pretty good
reviews.reviewText: It may not be the latest and greatest (can only use 10th and 11th gen intel CPUs and we’re on gen 13) but it’s still awesome, comes with a lot of cool stuff and the mono block from EK is sweet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Very high chance of getting a defective and no money back
reviews.reviewText: Motherboard fried the cpu and a bloody m.2 just found out acutlly and returning it is impossible aperntly as I sent it back and they are not refunding me the money as I'm sure of address but they are saying still not received buyer be ware it's s trap

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Too expensive and need to invest a lot more after buying
reviews.reviewText: Very Annoying fact is that you need special water cooling in order to turn this thing on…so not only that it’s 1500 USD, you’ll need between 500-1500 more for water cooler solution to connect to the water block it came with, also too little USB ports and no USB-C on back, also, if u use all nv.2 ssd slots you cannot use the whole board as supposed to…I think to just get the hero version get same same features for third the price…

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Holy Bawlz! Easily the most savage motherboard I've ever seen.
reviews.reviewText: It isn't lost on me, how crazy pricey this item is, and I feel lucky to have the ability to splurge on this item for my latest PC refresh. I cannot possibly put all of this thing to work, but just WOW @ how insane the feature set is, how great the build quality, and that I'm so excited to start obsessing over the cooling loop design.I have a solid month to focus and complete my parts gathering for the project, so I think I'll be almost done by the time my wife is ready to speak to me again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Expensive but beautiful
reviews.reviewText: Nice to have but get expensive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great as long as you know what you're getting into.
reviews.reviewText: This board is incredible! The performance is off the charts. Once I sold my kidney the price was really not that bad. Other customers may not see the value in doing so, but for me it was completely worth it. After all couldn't be content with a $200 motherboard that does the same thing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best EATX Xtreme board out here!!!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Asus Maximus XIII Extreme Glacial motherboard!!! This all-in-one water cooled board was the best money spent ever. I get top performance out of all of my memory, GPU, CPU. The integrated status window for temperature, frequency, fan speed or just a logo was a great ad. No need for raspberry pi. The EK water block keeps the CPU, VRM, PCH and the chipset are cool. The set up was almost plug and play. I added Samsung 970 Evo plus M.2 memory. Getting the motherboard to recognize the memory was not straightforward however that was the only glitch that I ran into during set up.If you have the budget it’s a must have.
